TextView.android:text: One large egg (50 grams) provides 6.3 grams of protein.
One half of a chicken breast (86 grams) provides 26.7 grams of protein.
One cup (246 mL) of dairy milk provides 8.32 grams of protein.
A 3-ounce (85-gram) serving of lean beef provides 24.6 grams of protein.
All types of fish are high in protein. For example, half a salmon fillet (124 grams) provides 30.5 grams of protein, while a cod fillet (180 grams) provides 41 grams of protein.
One cup (185 grams) of cooked quinoa provides 8 grams of protein.
One slice (60 grams) of Ezekiel bread provides 6 grams of protein.
A 3-ounce (85-gram) serving of turkey provides 25.6 grams of protein.
A 3-ounce (85-gram) serving of cooked clams provides 21.8 grams of protein, while the same serving of shrimp provides 20.4 grams of protein.
Salmon, Chicken, Turkey, Bison, Whole eggs, and Lean cuts of beef (such as flank or sirloin steak).
tofu, edamame, tempeh, peas, and chickpeas
oats, rice, breads, pastas, and quinoa
milk, cottage cheese, kefir, and Greek yogurt
almonds, walnuts, flax seeds, olive oil, and nut butters like natural peanut or almond butter
avocados, berries, apples, bananas, pears, oranges, grapes, etc.
squash, sweet potatoes, peas, kale, peppers, zucchini, broccoli, tomatoes, cauliflower, etc.
French fries, onion rings, doughnuts, chicken strips, cheese sticks, etc
tacos, burgers, pizza, hot dogs, etc.
soda, candy, sports drinks, sugary baked goods, sweetened tea, ice cream, sweet coffee drinks, etc.
cookies, chips, sugary cereals, pastries, etc.
